items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details: At its May 14, 2013, Governing Board Meeting, the Board of Trustees approved the FY2013-2014 Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates & Corresponding Deadlines. However, at the request of a couple of board members, the Board is being asked to consider removing the July 9, 2013, Governing Board Meeting from this schedule. Therefore, it is recommended the Board approve the requested revision to the FY2013-2014 Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates & Corresponding Deadlines as submitted.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a revision of the FY2013-2014 Schedule of Governing Board Meeting Dates & Corresponding Deadline to remove the July 11, 2013, meeting from the schedule.

items.item_details: On February 12, 2013, the Board scheduled a Training and Development Study Session. The goal of that session was to review model practices and standards for “effective trusteeship” with a special emphasis on the importance of speaking “with one voice”.  The session reviewed guidelines about the governance role of the board as policy makers differentiated from the administrative and managerial role of the Chancellor in the implementation of board policy. Review sessions and discussion centered on six different areas as follows: • Board Vision/Mission/Goals • Effective Governance Processes: The Carver Governance Model • Current Board Structure: Committees and Task Forces • Board Self Evaluation and Workplan Development • Board Skills Development Program • Board Master Calendar. On March 12, 2013, the Board reviewed an information item that presented a summary of board development and training options resulting from the Board Study Session. On April 23, 2013, the  board reviewed and discussed a "first reading/action" item on the same subject. This item reflects input from prior board discussions and represents the proposed board training and development schedule for the 2013/2014 academic year. Attachments include the board training and development calendar and budget source.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the proposed SJECCD Board Training and Development Schedule.
items.item_text: SJECCD Board Training and Development Schedule
items.item_text_raw: 2. SJECCD Board Training and Development Schedule

items.item_details:
In November 2012, the Board approved a Project Assignment Amendment with Artik Art & Architecture to provide Programing, Design and Construction phase administration services for the Photo Lab Relocation Project at San Jose City College. The project involves the relocation of two lab-classrooms from the 100 Building to the Technology Center. The existing photography labs located in the 100 Building are substandard due to lack of ventilation, deteriorated plumbing, building finishes, non-ADA accessible space, etc. The new photo lab will provide improved facilities along with the opportunity to consolidate the program's labs and classrooms into one building. This project is also a vital prerequisite to the VoTech Renovation project, scheduled to begin construction in late fall 2013.
	 
Artik has regularly met with the project Design Committee, made up of SJCC faculty and administration, since November 2012 to establish the College's needs in constructing the classroom and lab space.  Design drawings have been prepared and have been reviewed and approved by the Design Committee. As noted, one of the critical components of the new space is adequate ventilation; exhaust and fresh air for the chemicals used in the film and darkroom processes. Based on input from the Design Committee, Artik designed the mechanical system to provide sufficient exhaust and fresh air to the labs utilizing specifications for the exhaust hoods that the College intended to purchase. The proposed mechanical system would result in a substantial and costly addition to the existing mechanical system in the Technology Center. To mitigate these costs, both Artik and members of the Design Committee reached out to several different equipment vendors and were able to locate an exhaust hood that requires significantly less air volume to function yet still maintains a safe environment for the lab. By redesigning the mechanical system around the specifications for the new exhaust hoods, the project team was able to considerably downsize the cost and scope of the mechanical system for the new labs, which is also expected to produce a significant savings to the operating costs for the Photo Lab.
	 
This additional design fee of $6,300 to downsize the mechanical system represents a good value, as it is expected to save over $30,000 in construction costs to the College.
	 
Original Agreement:                     $89,000.00
Previous Revisions:                     $         0.00
This Revision:                              $   6,300.00
Revised Agreement:                     $95,300.00
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Revision #01 to PAA SJCC-01 with Artik Art & Architecture, increasing the cost of design and construction phase services on the SJCC Photo Lab Relocation Project in the amount of $6,300.

items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: PAA Revision #01 to Artik Art & Architecture for Design Services on Photo Lab Relocation Project #31121 at SJCC

items.item_details:
Under current law, California community colleges offer equal access opportunity to all regardless of socioeconomic status or family background. This tradition of affordable, open access to community colleges is important to maintaining a pathway to a better life for all Californians regardless of their background.
	 
Assembly Bill 955 would authorize community college districts to create a “pay-to-play,” two-tier pricing system that advantages individuals of greater wealth; and would, therefore, make socioeconomic background a determiner for access and success in the California community colleges. It would be wrong for the state to eliminate the community college promise of equal, open access for all regardless of socioeconomic status or family background.
	 
For these reasons, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt a resolution in opposition of Assembly Bill 955.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt a resolution in opposition of AB 955 - Two Tiered Access to Community Colleges
items.item_text: Resolution No. 052813-1 in opposition of AB 955- Two Tiered Access to Community Colleges
items.item_text_raw: 4. Resolution No. 052813-1 in opposition of AB 955- Two Tiered Access to Community Colleges

items.item_details: The District Strategic Planning goals and objectives will be presented to the Board of Trustees for a first reading.  A team consisting of over 50 constituent members from accross the district have participated in a process to develop these goals and objectives.  The steps in the process will be presented as well as next steps to institutionalize the process of strategic planning in the District, including alignment with the colleges' and Workforce Institute plans.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees will be presented with information about the new California Community Colleges Student Success Scorecard.  Staff will present information about the responsibility of the Community Colleges as it relates to reaction to Scorecard data and the timeline for reporting to the local Board of Trustees as mandated by the California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office.

items.item_details:
The Board has been presented with information and discussed the Theater & Vocational Technology project at San Jose City College at numerous meetings dating back to 2011. 
A brief history of Board Meetings at which the project has been discussed by the Board is below:
Nov. 29, 2011: Updated 2025 Facilities Master Plan, Bond List revision with new Theater.
March 13, 2012: Presentation on Lease-Leaseback Delivery method
June 12, 2012: Further information on Lease-Leaseback Delivery method, Bond list revision consolidating Theater & Vocational Technology projects for efficiency.
July 10, 2012: Approval of Lease-Leaseback delivery method & design contract with Marcy Wong Donn Logan Architects for programming services.
October 9, 2012: Project update presented to the Board.
Dec. 11, 2012: Bond list revision to include sitework & demolition.
Feb. 26, 2013: Approval of selection of Lease-Leaseback Contractor (Kitchell).
March 12, 2013: Approval of design services agreement with MWDL Architects.
April 9, 2013: Presentation on Project background and history at request of the Board.
	 
Marcy Wong Donn Logan Architects completed the schematic design phase of the project on May 16, 2013.  In keeping with the Boardâs request, the schematic design for the Theater & Vocational Technology project is presented to the Board to provide insight into the progress of the project.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Schematic design presentation for the Theater & Vocational Technology Project (Media Arts Center and Vocational Technology Building) at San Jose City College
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Schematic design presentation for the Theater & Vocational Technology Project (Media Arts Center and Vocational Technology Building) at San Jose City College

items.item_details:
On May 14, 1013, the Board of Trustees received an update on the programing and space planning efforts for the New District Office Building located at 40 S. Market Street.  At the conclusion of the presentation, the Trustees expressed an interest in receiving more detailed information with respect to the programing of the first floor, specifically the new Board Room. 
	 
This information item provides a more detailed look at the proposed programing of the first floor public spaces, including the Board Room.  The attached presentation from HMC Architects will review the process and criteria followed to arrive at the current program, and will highlight the attributes of the space plan.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: New Board Room Programing Review

items.item_details: Presentation to the Board of Trustees for the purpose of communicating the District’s 2013-2014 Legislative Plan.  The presentation will include an overview of SJECCD's recent history of legislative advocacy as well as cover the state legislative process, the state calendar and help to establish priorities for SJECCD.  An updated list of bills with position recommendations for SJECCD will be provided as a first read to the Board, with approval of a positions recommended at the June 11th Board meeting.

items.item_details: This item represents the first step in the process of review of board policies governing the election of board officers. Consonant with our review process existing policies are compared with model CCLC policies and include a time frame for input through the participatory governance process.  Attached are two documents as follows:  1.  BP 2210 (Officers) as most currently approved by the Board of Trustees;  and,  2. BP 2210 (Officers) as most currently offered by the Community College League of California (CCLC). In fall 2013, revised language reflecting input received through the participatory governance process will be recommended to the board for consideration and approval.
